document.masterDocTitle: One new and three known species of Geocenamus Thorne & Malek, 1968 (Nematoda: Merliniidae) from Iran

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: One new and three known species of Geocenamus Thorne & Malek, 1968 (Nematoda: Merliniidae) from Iran

subSubSection.paragraph:
(
Table 5
; Fig. 4 , 5 P–T, 6 K– O , 8 A–D)

Two populations of this species were identified (see
Table 5
). This species comes close to
G. paniculoides
and
G. siddiqii
in having refractive basal extensions of the cephalic framework (see
G. paniculoides
for differences).

G. tenuidens
Thorne & Malek, 1968
( type species)

tr.td: subcylindrical BR IS conical NR N conical NR N

subSubSection.paragraph: LFI: number of incisures in each lateral field; LS: number of longitudinal striae (UN: longitudinal striae are present, but unknown in number; + and – after data mean ‘more than’ and
less than’, respectively); Tail terminus shape (BR: bluntly rounded; H: hemispherical; NR: narrowly rounded; SH: subhemispherical); TTS: tail terminus striation (S: striated; IS:

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4.
Geocenamus tartuensis
from Iran; A, C–E, G & I–L (female), B, F & H (male). A & B: Pharyngeal region; C–F: Anterior end; G: Part of reproductive system; H, K & L: Tail; I: Cross section at mid-body; J: Cuticle and lateral field.

FIGURE 5. Anterior end of
Geocenamus
species from Iran; A–D, F–I, K–N & P–S (female), E, J, O & T (male). A–E:
G. conicaudatus
n. sp.
; F–J:
G. rugosus
; K–O:
G. paniculoides
; P–T:
G. tartuensis
. All scale-bars = 10 µm.

FIGURE 6. Posterior end of females of
Geocenamus
species from Iran. A–E:

n. sp.
; F–J:
